title: Chickpea Curry
description: Learn how to make Chickpea Curry. This recipe includes 27 ingredients and 5 detailed steps.
keywords: indian, chickpea, curry, avocado, neutral-flavored, coriander, seeds, heaping, cumin, fresh, dried, leaves, large, yellow, onion,
ingredientPreview: 30 mL avocado oil or neutral-flavored oil
searchText: chickpea curry 30 ml avocado oil or neutral-flavored oil 10 ml coriander seeds 5 ml heaping cumin seeds 15 to 20 fresh or 30 dried curry leaves 1 large yellow or red onion, finely diced 6 garlic cloves, minced 5 cm piece fresh ginger, minced or grated 1 to 3 serrano peppers, diced 30 ml tomato paste 227 g roma tomatoes, diced 10 ml diamond crystal kosher salt (adjust if using other salts) 400 ml can full-fat coconut milk 120 ml water 850 g (2 cans) chickpeas, drained and rinsed 45 ml tahini, well-stirred 2.5 ml organic cane sugar, brown sugar, or coconut sugar 200-230 g (1 small head) swiss chard or lacinato kale, ribs removed and thinly sliced 10 ml garam masala 7.5 to 15 ml freshly squeezed lemon or lime juice, to taste 1 large handful of chopped cilantro leaves and tender stems 1 large handful of chopped fresh mint leaves ground spices: 7.5 ml curry powder 5 ml ground coriander 2.5 ml ground cinnamon 2.5 ml freshly grated nutmeg 1.25 ml ground turmeric freshly ground black pepper heat 30 ml oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. add coriander and cumin seeds, toast for 1 minute until fragrant. add curry leaves, cover briefly. add diced onion with a pinch of salt and cook for 5 minutes. add garlic, ginger, and serrano peppers, cook for 1-2 minutes. stir in ground spices and tomato paste for 90 seconds. add diced tomatoes and 10 ml salt, cook for 5 minutes until soft and oil releases. pour in chickpeas, coconut milk, water, tahini, and sugar. stir well, bring to a simmer, then cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. add the thinly sliced swiss chard or kale to the simmering curry. cook for 4-5 minutes until tender. stir in garam masala. remove from heat. stir in lemon or lime juice, chopped cilantro, and mint. season with additional salt to taste. let rest for 5-15 minutes before serving with rice or flatbread. kichererbsen-curry 30 ml avocadoöl oder neutrales öl 10 ml koriandersamen 5 ml gehäufte kreuzkümmelsamen 15
